Undivided Attention Called For 
     You have not done your duty as an overseer of the churches of God. . . . You have abilities, but home cares and home responsibilities have borne heavily upon you. These things hedge you about so that it makes it almost an impossibility for you to use your tact, your ability and strength, to the great work entrusted to you. Ministers who fill their houses with children take cares upon themselves which God never designed they should. The 


                                   -167- 

management of these self-imposed burdens detracts from their usefulness, their devotion, their time, and their duties in the service of God.
